author: @franceonu
title: France reaffirms its support for United Nations efforts in the Great Lakes (...) - France ONU
text:
France reaffirms its support for United Nations efforts in the Great Lakes region
[[fr]](la-france-reaffirme-son-soutien-a-l-action-des-nations-unies-dans-la-region-des)
GREAT LAKES REGION
STATEMENT BY MR. JEROME BONNAFONT,
PERMANENT REPRESENTATIVE OF FRANCE TO THE UNITED NATIONS
TO THE SECURITY COUNCIL
New York, April 16, 2025
France reaffirms its support for the action of the United Nations in the region, that of the Special Envoy of the Secretary-General and MONUSCO, as well as that of humanitarian actors. In this regard, I would like to thank the Special Envoy of the Secretary-General for the Great Lakes Region, Mr. Huang Xia, and the Executive Director of UNICEF, Ms. Catherine Russell, for their statements, in particular for their action. I thank Minister Tete Antonio for the elements he provided as chairperson of the Angolan Presidency of the African Union, and I welcome the presence of the Minister of State of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
Four messages from France today:
Firstly, the horrors that far too many children are facing and witnessing are proof that the humanitarian situation calls for action.
As Ms. Russell pointed out, the ongoing conflict is devastating the lives of hundreds of thousands of children in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo. The scale of rape and sexual violence involving children, as documented by UNICEF, is shocking. The situation is aggravated by the offensive carried out by the M23 since January, with the support and participation of Rwandan Defense Forces. The hostilities must cease in order to put an end to violations of international humanitarian law and of human rights, as well as summary executions of children, their recruitment by armed groups, systematic sexual violence, and all other serious violations of children’s rights, which must not go unpunished.
Secondly, as outlined in the resolution 2773, the conclusion of a ceasefire is imperative.
Despite numerous efforts, fighting continues, fueling the risk of regional expansion of the conflict. The communities of Southern and Eastern Africa reminded the need for a ceasefire in a joint call on February 8. The Security Council unanimously reaffirmed that in Resolution 2773. The Congolese and Rwandan presidents have declared their commitment to it in Doha last month. We must not wait any longer. Once concluded, the ceasefire must be monitored through a credible verification mechanism. MONUSCO must be prepared to play a role here. We also continue to call on Rwanda to end the illegal presence of its armed forces on the territory of another sovereign State in violation of its territorial integrity and in defiance of the resolutions of this Council.
Thirdly, given the urgency of the situation, France supports dialogue initiatives.
In particular, France supports regional mediation efforts provided by the African Union, the East African Community and the Southern African Development Community. These organizations have a key role to play in contributing to a cessation of hostilities, to a de-escalation of the crisis, and to finding a political solution through the harmonised Luanda and Nairobi processes. The appointment of the President of the Republic of Togo, Mr. Faure Gnassingbé, as the new African Union mediator must continue the momentum initiated by President Joao Lourenço, whose efforts France commends. We must implement the agreed parameters for an immediate and definitive withdrawal of Rwandan defense forces from Congolese territory and the demobilization of the FDLR by the Democratic Republic of the Congo. We believe that civil society dialogue initiatives are paramount, such as the one provided by the Conférence épiscopale nationale du Congo and the Eglise du Christ du Congo for a social pact for peace in the Democratic Republic of Congo and the Great Lakes region. Finally, France actively supports the work of the Special Envoy to promote regional cooperation, including with regards to the traceability of natural resources.
Fourthly, the convergence of all efforts is needed.
We must support all these efforts so that we can ensure a lasting political resolution as soon as possible. Last week, France as president of the Council, organized informal discussions with Angola, Kenya, Zimbabwe, Qatar and the United Nations to work towards aligning and coordinating this initiatives. We must act to ensure an effective ceasefire, the opening of humanitarian corridors, as well as the re-opening of the Goma airport and the full implementation of Resolution 2773.
There is no military solution to the conflict in the Great Lakes region. Negotiations must be concluded in order to end this crisis and work towards peace and shared prosperity in the region.
The Council must remain actively involved to create conditions conducive to that end. We must be prepared to shoulder our responsabilites in the absence of progress.
Thank you.
Top of the page

author: AB Newswire
title: Ela Vashishtha’s Digital Medical Pad Promises Efficient Care Anywhere | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
Ms. Ela Vashishtha, local digital healthcare leader in Texas area and innovator of digital medical pad. Digital Media Pad prototype
The healthcare landscape is constantly evolving, demanding innovative solutions to address challenges faced by patients and medical professionals alike. In this pursuit of progress, health resources and strategy leader Ela Vashishtha has emerged as a pioneer, spearheading the development of a groundbreaking invention: the Digital Medical Pad.
More than just a technological innovation, this patented device embodies Ms. Vashishtha's deep understanding of healthcare complexities, honed through her vast experience managing a $3 billion portfolio and driving data-driven initiatives across 25+ hospitals in her state of residency. This expertise shines through in every facet of the Digital Medical Pad, designed to address critical issues plaguing healthcare systems, particularly in resource-constrained settings.
Secure Access, Streamlined Processes
At the heart of the invention lies a secure biometric scanner. Gone are the days of misplaced charts and stolen identities; fingerprints grant authorized personnel instant access to a patient's medical history, ensuring both privacy and efficient care delivery. Medication management takes a leap forward with the pad's ability to display medication history and facilitate digital order creation. This not only reduces waiting times but also minimizes errors and potential drug interactions.
Real-Time Intelligence Powering Decisions
The Digital Medical Pad transcends mere data storage. Embedded AI and machine learning algorithms work synergistically with real-time data to empower healthcare professionals. Imagine a scenario where a doctor, upon entering a patient's fever symptom, receives treatment suggestions tailored to the patient's unique medical profile, considering factors like co-existing conditions and potential allergies. This level of real-time decision support enhances diagnostic accuracy and optimizes treatment plans, paving the way for personalized, effective care.
Bridging the Global Healthcare Divide
Ms. Vashishtha's vision extends beyond borders. Recognizing the immense potential of the Digital Medical Pad in resource-limited countries, she is leading the charge in adapting the technology for these specific contexts. The device's affordability and portability make it ideal for rural areas, where access to quality healthcare has traditionally been limited. By eliminating paper records and cumbersome processes, the pad promises to revolutionize care delivery in underprivileged regions, democratizing access to crucial medical information and services.
Partnerships for Progress
The journey towards widespread adoption of the Digital Medical Pad is underway. Ms. Vashishtha is actively seeking partnerships with multiple entities in India, aiming to pilot the device in rural areas and smaller cities. These collaborations will serve as testaments to the pad's effectiveness and pave the way for its broader implementation across developing nations. Currently, she is partnering with and providing strategic advice on product advancement ideas, market strategies, future iterations of testing the pad in Indian healthcare market.
A Beacon of Hope
Ela Vashishtha's Digital Medical Pad opens the possibility of a future where healthcare is accessible, efficient, and personalized in developing and developed worlds alike. By harnessing the power of technology and focusing on real-world needs, Ms. Vashishtha is trying to forge a path towards a healthier, more equitable world. This innovation holds the potential to bridge healthcare divides, empower medical professionals, and improve the lives of millions, making it a truly transformative force in the global healthcare landscape.

author: margherita-marullo
title: Spain on High Alert for More Disastrous Weather Arriving Today Into the Weekend: Flooding and Torrential Rain Forecasted
text:
Menu
Sign in now Close Travel Guides Destinations Travel Hacks Lifestyle Sign in Newsletter Trending Travel News Destinations Things To Do Discovery Wildlife Close Spain on High Alert for More Disastrous Weather Arriving Today Into the Weekend: Flooding and Torrential Rain Forecasted By Margherita Marullo Published 2 hours ago Thread Your changes have been saved

Manage Your List Follow Followed Follow with Notifications Follow Unfollow Share Facebook X LinkedIn Reddit Flipboard Copy link Email Link copied to clipboard Sign in to your TheTravel account
ID 15335033 Veniamin Kraskov - Dreamstime.com Spain is already suffering from the beyond catastrophic damage incurred to several regions in the country on October 29th, due to the powerful storm system ( DANA - Depresión Aislada en Niveles Altos / Isolated Depression at High Levels ) moving through, leaving behind debris, damaged vehicles, submerged properties, missing persons, and significant loss of life in its wake: both human and animals.
&#x2715 Remove Ads As residents, officials, and emergency personnel work hard to assess the incredible damage in the aftermath of the storm, while searching for additional victims, Spain’s weather agency, AEMET, has issued numerous weather warning alerts for more disastrous weather arriving today, into the weekend.
The weather alerts target the same region of Valencia for the next three days, which has witnessed apocalyptic damage and flooding, losing 155 residents out of the 158 people who have lost their lives, as well as additional regions in the south and east of the country.
Related Spain Floods Latest: Storm of the Century Claims Nearly 160 Lives as Desperate Search for the Missing Continues Bridges Demolished and Roads Now Graveyards: Residents Are Terrified That the Next Weather System Will Take Them
Residents Brace for More Damaging Weather as Red, Amber, and Yellow Alerts Issued Across Eastern, Central, and Southern Spain
Image credit: BBC Weather Spain inclement weather forecast showing high-risk flood areas for today (November 1) through the weekend &#x2715 Remove Ads Today, through Sunday, AEMET has issued one red alert (so far) for the Huelva Coast, southwest Andalucía around Huelva and Condado; numerous amber alerts for the Tarragona and Castellón regions, as well as Menorca and Mallorca; and 30 yellow alerts for severe storms and rain in several regions. A full list of the locations, alerts, and warnings issued can be found here .
Rainfall of 140 mm within a 12-hour period is predicted to fall in Huelva Coast areas under the red weather alert for today, Friday, November 1st, particularly Andalucía; with the already flood-ridden areas of the Valencia community , Balearic Islands, and Catalonia receiving up to 50 mm of rainfall in less than one hour today through Sunday.
